meanings.definition: To give pleasure or satisfaction to
meanings.sent1: Eating ice cream can gratify your taste buds.
meanings.sent2: The kind words from her friend gratify her heart.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's wagging tail seemed to gratify the grumpy old man.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful sunset gratified her longing for peace.
meanings.sent5: The successful completion of the project will gratify the team's efforts.

meanings.definition: To indulge or satisfy (a desire or appetite)
meanings.sent1: She decided to gratify her craving for chocolate cake.
meanings.sent2: The bookstore gratified his love for adventure novels.
meanings.sent3: The decision to take a day off work gratified his inner child.
meanings.sent4: The music festival gratified her hunger for live performances.
meanings.sent5: The surprise gift gratified his wish for recognition.
